org.apache.distributedlog.namespace

Interface DistributedLogNamespace


  • @Beta
public interface DistributedLogNamespace
    A namespace is the basic unit for managing a set of distributedlogs.

    Namespace Interface

    The DistributedLogNamespace interface is implemented by different backend providers. There are several components are required for an implementation:

    1. Log Management -- manage logs in a given namespace. e.g. create/open/delete log, list of logs, watch the changes of logs.
    2. Access Control -- manage the access controls for logs in the namespace.

    Namespace Location

    At the highest level, a DistributedLogNamespace is located by a URI. The location URI is in string form has the syntax

    distributedlog[-provider]:provider-specific-path

    where square brackets [...] delineate optional components and the characters - and : stand for themselves.

    The provider part in the URI indicates what is the backend used for this namespace. For example: distributedlog-bk URI is storing logs in bookkeeper, while distributedlog-mem URI is storing logs in memory. The provider part is optional. It would use bookkeeper backend if the provider part is omitted.

    Since:
    0.3.32
    See Also:
    DistributedLogManager

        throws InvalidStreamNameException,
               IOException
        Create a log named logName.
        Parameters:
        logName - name of the log
        Throws:
        InvalidStreamNameException - if log name is invalid.
        IOException - when encountered issues with backend.

        LogNotFoundException - if log doesn't exist
        IOException - when encountered issues with backend

      • openLog

        DistributedLogManager openLog(String logName)
                       throws InvalidStreamNameException,
                              IOException
        Open a log named logName. A distributedlog manager is returned to access log logName.
        Parameters:
        logName - name of the log
        Returns:
        distributedlog manager instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidStreamNameException - if log name is invalid.
        IOException - when encountered issues with backend.

      • openLog

        DistributedLogManager openLog(String logName,
                              com.google.common.base.Optional<DistributedLogConfiguration> logConf,
                              com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.distributedlog.config.DynamicDistributedLogConfiguration> dynamicLogConf,
                              com.google.common.base.Optional<org.apache.bookkeeper.stats.StatsLogger> perStreamStatsLogger)
                       throws InvalidStreamNameException,
                              IOException
        Open a log named logName with specific log configurations.

        This method allows the caller to override global configuration settings by supplying log configuration overrides. Log config overrides come in two flavors, static and dynamic. Static config never changes in the lifecyle of DistributedLogManager, dynamic config changes by reloading periodically and safe to access from any context.

        Parameters:
        logName - name of the log
        logConf - static log configuration
        dynamicLogConf - dynamic log configuration
        Returns:
        distributedlog manager instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidStreamNameException - if log name is invalid.
        IOException - when encountered issues with backend.

      • logExists

        boolean logExists(String logName)
           throws IOException
        Check whether the log logName exist.
        Parameters:
        logName - name of the log
        Returns:
        true if the log exists, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IOException - when encountered exceptions on checking
